XML Input File======================Configuration-------------We need to provide some data in `<configuration> </configuration>` in order to get a proper output file:		<frame>			<size>				<width>640</width>				<height>360</height>				<sar>1.0</sar>			</size>			<rate>				30			</rate>		</frame>Firstly we need to provide information about output file - size of a frame,  Storage Aspect Ratio and framerate.		<codecs>			<video>				<key>libx264</key>				<!--key>flv1</key-->			</video>			<audio>				<key>libmp3lame</key>				<!--key>libvo_aacenc</key-->			</audio>		</codecs>then we setup codecs		<subtitles>../data/subtitles.srt</subtitles>finally we can also add soft subtitles, by providing path to the file with subtitles.Example input file------------------Below is an example of XML input file:<videogen>	<configuration>		<frame>			<size>				<width>640</width>				<height>360</height>				<sar>1.0</sar>			</size>			<rate>				30			</rate>		</frame>		<codecs>			<video>				<key>libx264</key>				<!--key>flv1</key-->			</video>			<audio>				<key>libmp3lame</key>				<!--key>libvo_aacenc</key-->			</audio>		</codecs>	</configuration>	<sequence>		<shot>			<video>				<load type="AudioVideoFile">					../data/sintel_trailer-1080p.mp4				</load>				<effect type="VideoRange">					<unit>s</unit>					<from>10</from>					<to>20</to>				</effect>				<effect type="VideoRepeat">					<times>2</times>				</effect>			</video>		</shot>		<shot>			<image>				<board>					<configuration>						<size>							<width>640</width>							<height>360</height>						</size>						<background>							<color>#444444</color>						</background>					</configuration>					<text>						<content>ijo ijo!</content>						<color>#00FFFF</color>						<point>							<x>40</x>							<y>200</y>						</point>					</text>					<picture>						<filename>							../data/cc.jpg						</filename>						<point>							<x>40</x>							<y>300</y>						</point>						<size>							<x>200</x>							<y>101</y>						</size>						<transparent>							0						</transparent>					</picture>				</board>			</image>			<audio>				<generate type="SilenceGenerate">					<unit>s</unit>					<duration>10</duration>				</generate>			</audio>		</shot>	</sequence></videogen>Drawing shapes using XML and boards features=======================================In new version of VideoGen were added features that allow genereting borads(images/slides) from XML input. Here are some examples on how to draw shapes.Drawing lines using XML line element------------------------------------    <line>        <width>2</width>        <color>green</color>        <point>            <x>0</y>            <Y>0</Y>        </point>        <point>            <x>10</y>            <x>20</y>        </point>    </line>In this example, we want to draw a simple line from point A(0,0) to point B(10,20). Width of the line is 2 pixels.Drawing rectangles using XML rectangle element-----------------------------------------    <rectangle>        <color>red</color>        <point>            <x>150</y>            <x>240</y>        </point>         <size>            <width>800</width>            <height>600</height>        </size>    </rectangle>To draw a rectangle or square use <rectangle>. To draw the rectangle there must be provided the point which represensts top left corner of the shape and it's size.Drawing elipse using XML elipse element------------------------------------    <ellipse>            <color>red</color>            <center>                <point>                    <X>256</X>                    <Y>256</Y>                </point>            </center>            <radius>                <X>150</X>                <Y>70</Y>            </radius>    </ellipse>To draw an elipse, there must be provieded the center and radius of the shape.
